data.title: Department of ECE, Gauhati University
data.meta_description:
Department of ECE, Gauhati University | 347 followers on LinkedIn. Excellence is not a destination. It is a continuous journey that never ends. | The Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering was established under Faculty of Technology, Gauhati University during the year 2009-2010. 
Gauhati University is NAAC A graded and the current NIRF (2022) rank is 36 which is best among the universities of North East.
Since 2016, Gauhati University has remained within top 50 among the Indian Universities.
data.text:
"Education is the passport to the future, for tomorrow belongs to those who prepare for it today." — Malcolm X Yet another batch of students completed their final academic presentation of their B.Tech course, with the 8th Semester Final Year Project presentation in the department of Electronics and Communication engineering, Gauhati University on 3rd July , 2024 with great enthusiasm and zeal. As they prepare themselves to move ahead to pursue their own dreams, we wish them all the best for a bright future.

The Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering has commenced an 8-week Summer Internship Program for thirty B-Tech students starting on June 18th, 2024. The inaugural session was graced by Prof. Kandarpa Kumar Sarma ,Head of the ECE Department (Chief Guest), along with Dr. Anjan Kumar Talukdar , Manash Pratim Sarma , Apurba Bikas Kalita and Dr. Nilakshi Devi. The program was coordinated by Dr. Surajit Deka, faculty member of the ECE department and hosted by Amrita Choudhury, Research Scholar in the ECE department. Several other staff members and research scholars from the department also attended the event. The vote of thanks was delivered by Manash Pratim Sarma, Assistant Professor, Dept of ECE. Students are being trained in cutting-edge technologies including #MachineLearning, #VLSI, #Communication, and #EmbeddedSystem. This program is a crucial part of our department’s dedication to providing hands-on, practical experience to enthusiastic students. Along with structured sessions, students will engage in mini projects, allowing them to learn about real-world scenarios and apply their knowledge and skills. The expertise of our dedicated faculty members will ensure that this internship is highly beneficial for the students. The program has seen massive participation from students of various reputed institutions such as AEC, JIST, DUIET, and GU.

It is with deep sadness and heavy heart that we share the news of the demise of Masuma Rahman, an MTech alumnus from the Department of ECE , Gauhati University (2018-2021 batch). Masuma had been suffering from life threatening and critical illness over the last few years and she breathed her last on Wednesday, 12 th June 2024, leaving all of us in deep shock and grief. Masuma was a brilliant and dedicated student, a kind friend, and a loving family member. Her dedication and resilience in the face of adversity is truly inspiring. She leaves behind a legacy of strength and perseverance that will never be forgotten. Masuma's courage, determination, and positive spirit touched the lives of everyone who knew her. Our heartfelt condolences go out to Masuma’s family during this difficult time. Our thoughts and prayers are with them as they navigate this profound loss. May Masuma’s soul rest in eternal peace. She will be deeply missed and forever remembered.

UDHBHAV 2.0 , a Techfest of the Department of ECE, Gauhati University was organised during 9, 10 and 11 May, 2024. The event was organized by the Department with support from the IEEE Student Branch of Gauhati University, IETE Guwahati Section and RESONICS (Society of the Department of ECE). Further, the event received support from the OIL, Assam Science Technology and Environment Council (ASTEC) and IEEE Power Electronics Society attached with the IEEE Guwahati Subsection, Assam Start-up etc. The inaugural event was held on 9 May, 2024 at 9 AM. Dr. Chandan Kumar, EEE, IIT Guwahati and Chairperson, IEEE Guwahati Subsection was the Guest of Honour. Chittaranjan Oja, SP (Communication), Assam Police and Chairperson, IETE Guwahati Section, Prof. Tulshi Bezbaruah, Director, GUIST and Prof. Kandarpa Kumar Sarma , HoD, ECE, GU spoke on the occasion. Manash Pratim Sarma , Assistant Professor, ECE offered the vote of thanks. Some of the event held during the three days include Model Competition, Hackathon, Quiz, Chess, Short Film and Photography competition, Robo race, Robo sumo, Robo soccer, Circuit Solving, Coding Competition, Robotics Workshop etc. On 11 May, 2024, National Technology Day was celebrated. The keynote speech was delivered by Dr. Gaurav Trivedi , EEE, IITG coinciding with the theme of National Technology Day “From Schools to Startups: Igniting Young Minds to Innovate”. Dr. Navajit Saikia , HoD, ETE, Assam Engineering College also spoke on the occasion. The vote of thanks for the entire three-day event was delivered by Apurba Bikash Kalita, Assistant Professor, ECE. Over 500 participants from different schools, nearby colleges, institutions, universities etc took part in the event. We are thankful to Gauhati University, Our Sponsors, Our Estemed Guests, Judges of different competitions, HoD Prof. Kandarpa Kumar Sarma, Faculty Advisor Apurba Bikash Kalita and Manash Pratim Sarma , Dr. Jyoti Prakash Medhi, Dr.Anjan Kumar Talukdar , Dr.Lachit Dutta , Dr.Aradhana Misra, Dr Surajit Deka, Dr.Farhana Begum , Amitava Dey, , Ripul Kalita , Nava Talukdar , Hirak Goswami , Jeherul Islam , Bipul Patowary , Krishna Kamal Deka, Manash Pratim Goswami and dedicated soldiers Debabrat Sarma (As President), Mirel Azmi Huda (As Vice-President), Matiur Rahman (As General Secretary) and many more team members, Volunteers and Students whose hard work was significant to make the event successful. Kudos to all the Team members.

A Symposium on the Role of Semiconductor in securing the Vision of Viksit Bharat by 2047 was held on 13 March, 2024 at the Gallery 1 of the GUIST Building, Gauhati University from 9.30 AM. The symposium was organized by the Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Gauhati University. It started with the University anthem. It was followed by the welcome address by Prof. Kandarpa Kumar Sarma , HoD, ECE where he highlighted the importance of skill development and research for remaining relevant in the semiconductor industry. Next, Prof. Shikhar Kumar Sarma, Dean Faculty of Technology, GU and Prof. Tulshi Bezboruah, Director, GUIST spoke about the importance of the upcoming semiconductor complex in Assam. Later, Rupam Bora and Rajdeep Saikia of MTech, ECE and Dhruba Jyoti Sarma , Vishal Hazarika, and Kaustoov Priyam Kaushik , BTech 8th Sem, ECE made presentations about different aspects of semiconductor industry in India. The vote of thanks was offered by Manash Pratim Sarma , Assistant Professor, ECE, GU. The event was managed by Dr. Aradhana Misra, Assistant Professor, ECE. About two hundred students, research scholars, officers, staff and faculty members of Gauhati University took part in the event. The audience also witnessed the foundation laying ceremony of three semiconductor plants in Assam and Gujarat virtually by the Hon’ble Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The audience later joined the live streaming of the Address by Honourable PM Shri Narendra Modi, " India's Techade : Chips for Vikshit Bharat" . #VikshitBharat #Semiconductor #Techade
